intro: Conostylis albicans, commonly known as the white-headed conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in full sun. Conostylis albicans is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its delicate, clustered blooms.
